com.complexible.common.base

Class AtomicState<S extends Enum<S>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.complexible.common.base.AtomicState<S>

  • public class AtomicState<S extends Enum<S>>
extends Object
    Represents a mutable state that can be atomically updated via transitions. Actual states are represented as enumerations. This class guarantees that there will be a single current state at any time and at most one state transition action will be running at any time.
    Since:
    2.0.3
    Version:
    2.0.3
    Author:
    Evren Sirin

    • Nested Class Summary

      static class  AtomicState.Transition<S extends Enum<S>>
      A state transition action.
      static class  AtomicState.TransitionBuilder<S extends Enum<S>>

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Returns true if there is an allowable action from the current state.

      Throws IllegalArgumentException if the current state is one of the given states.

      Throws IllegalArgumentException if the current state is not equal to the given state.
      void checkStateNot(S theState)
      Throws IllegalArgumentException if the current state is equal to the given state.

      void set(S theState)
      Sets the current state disregarding any transition actions defined.
      void transition(AtomicState.Transition<S> theTransition)
      Transitions to a new state by executing the given action which will wait for any running state transition to complete first.
      void transitionNow(AtomicState.Transition<S> theTransition)
      Transitions to a new state by executing the given action and requesting any running transition to cancel.

      • transition

        public void transition(AtomicState.Transition<S> theTransition)
                throws Exception
        Transitions to a new state by executing the given action which will wait for any running state transition to complete first.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given action is not one of the predefined actions
        IllegalStateException - if the current state is not a valid initial state for the action
        Exception

      • transitionNow

        public void transitionNow(AtomicState.Transition<S> theTransition)
                   throws Exception
        Transitions to a new state by executing the given action and requesting any running transition to cancel.
        Throws:
        Exception
